content: welcome back as promised the finale of the initial kickoff series for my
channel doors I'll show you how to make one of these clip-on doors
compatible with this system the first thing we'll do is take three popsicle
sticks and a chisel or a screwdriver or anything with a tough corner with a lot
of effort draw it across the popsicle stick in order to carve a groove this
will give it a wood like texture once all three are done measure off two
inch lengths you should be able to get two per popsicle stick for a total of
six then cut them I use wire cutters because they have a lot of torque and
they're very strong they require a lot less effort than scissors then get some
double corrugated cardboard and cut out one and a half inches by one and 1/8
inch now fire up the hot glue gun apply a
thin bead in the center of the cardboard apply one plank to the glue ensuring
that it is dead center apply a little more glue on each side to attach the
other two planks then flip the door over and do the same thing with the other
three finally take some card stock 3/8 of an inch wide and cut to length and
wrap it around the outside ensure that you only go down 1/2 inch on the side
otherwise there will be no way for the door to clip on
here's an example of how to use the doors suppose you're in this room it's
20 by 30 you want to place a door here in order to access a hallway beyond it's
simple that's where you use the clip on door place a side tile here clip the
door on just like that place this here the grid is perfectly preserved no loss
or gain of space the miniature still fits if you don't like clip on walls
because you like to be able to open doors like this one or general other
features that's supported as well remove the side tile put a field tile there
instead place your door and you're good to go the hallway can go beyond likewise
if you have a hallway and you want to place your door in the middle of it this
door fits this is a two-inch base although it is an inch wide you could
use whatever it is that you have it fits because remember the interior space of
these tiles is a full two inches so any features that you have will work there
that's how the doors work you
